title: Google\Cloud\GkeBackup\V1\Backup
name: Backup
description:
Represents a request to perform a single point-in-time capture of some portion of the state of a GKE cluster, the record of the backup operation itself, and an anchor for the underlying artifacts that comprise the Backup (the config backup and VolumeBackups).

Next id: 28

Generated from protobuf message google.cloud.gkebackup.v1.Backup

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

methods.name: __construct
methods.description: Constructor.

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.name
params.description: Output only. The fully qualified name of the Backup. projects/*/locations/*/backupPlans/*/backups/*

params.name: data.uid
params.description: Output only. Server generated global unique identifier of UUID4

params.name: data.create_time
params.description: Output only. The timestamp when this Backup resource was created.

params.name: data.update_time
params.description: Output only. The timestamp when this Backup resource was last updated.

params.name: data.manual
params.description: Output only. This flag indicates whether this Backup resource was created manually by a user or via a schedule in the BackupPlan. A value of True means that the Backup was created manually.

params.name: data.labels
params.description: A set of custom labels supplied by user.

params.name: data.delete_lock_days
params.description: Minimum age for this Backup (in days). If this field is set to a non-zero value, the Backup will be "locked" against deletion (either manual or automatic deletion) for the number of days provided (measured from the creation time of the Backup). MUST be an integer value between 0-90 (inclusive). Defaults to parent BackupPlan's [backup_delete_lock_days][google.cloud.gkebackup.v1.BackupPlan.RetentionPolicy.backup_delete_lock_days] setting and may only be increased (either at creation time or in a subsequent update).

params.name: data.delete_lock_expire_time
params.description: Output only. The time at which an existing delete lock will expire for this backup (calculated from create_time + [delete_lock_days][google.cloud.gkebackup.v1.Backup.delete_lock_days]).

params.name: data.retain_days
params.description: The age (in days) after which this Backup will be automatically deleted. Must be an integer value >= 0: - If 0, no automatic deletion will occur for this Backup. - If not 0, this must be >= [delete_lock_days][google.cloud.gkebackup.v1.Backup.delete_lock_days]. Once a Backup is created, this value may only be increased. Defaults to the parent BackupPlan's [backup_retain_days][google.cloud.gkebackup.v1.BackupPlan.RetentionPolicy.backup_retain_days] value.

params.name: data.retain_expire_time
params.description: Output only. The time at which this Backup will be automatically deleted (calculated from create_time + [retain_days][google.cloud.gkebackup.v1.Backup.retain_days]).

params.name: data.encryption_key
params.description: Output only. The customer managed encryption key that was used to encrypt the Backup's artifacts. Inherited from the parent BackupPlan's [encryption_key][google.cloud.gkebackup.v1.BackupPlan.BackupConfig.encryption_key] value.

params.name: data.all_namespaces
params.description: Output only. If True, all namespaces were included in the Backup.

params.name: data.selected_namespaces
params.description: Output only. If set, the list of namespaces that were included in the Backup.

params.name: data.selected_applications
params.description: Output only. If set, the list of ProtectedApplications whose resources were included in the Backup.

params.name: data.contains_volume_data
params.description: Output only. Whether or not the Backup contains volume data. Controlled by the parent BackupPlan's [include_volume_data][google.cloud.gkebackup.v1.BackupPlan.BackupConfig.include_volume_data] value.

params.name: data.contains_secrets
params.description: Output only. Whether or not the Backup contains Kubernetes Secrets. Controlled by the parent BackupPlan's [include_secrets][google.cloud.gkebackup.v1.BackupPlan.BackupConfig.include_secrets] value.

params.name: data.cluster_metadata
params.description: Output only. Information about the GKE cluster from which this Backup was created.

params.name: data.state
params.description: Output only. Current state of the Backup

params.name: data.state_reason
params.description: Output only. Human-readable description of why the backup is in the current state.

params.name: data.complete_time
params.description: Output only. Completion time of the Backup

params.name: data.resource_count
params.description: Output only. The total number of Kubernetes resources included in the Backup.

params.name: data.volume_count
params.description: Output only. The total number of volume backups contained in the Backup.

params.name: data.size_bytes
params.description: Output only. The total size of the Backup in bytes = config backup size + sum(volume backup sizes)

params.name: data.etag
params.description: Output only. etag is used for optimistic concurrency control as a way to help prevent simultaneous updates of a backup from overwriting each other. It is strongly suggested that systems make use of the etag in the read-modify-write cycle to perform backup updates in order to avoid race conditions: An etag is returned in the response to GetBackup, and systems are expected to put that etag in the request to UpdateBackup or DeleteBackup to ensure that their change will be applied to the same version of the resource.

params.name: data.description
params.description: User specified descriptive string for this Backup.

params.name: data.pod_count
params.description: Output only. The total number of Kubernetes Pods contained in the Backup.

params.name: data.config_backup_size_bytes
params.description: Output only. The size of the config backup in bytes.

methods.name: getRetainDays
methods.description:
The age (in days) after which this Backup will be automatically deleted.

Must be an integer value >= 0:

  • If 0, no automatic deletion will occur for this Backup.
  • If not 0, this must be >= [delete_lock_days][google.cloud.gkebackup.v1.Backup.delete_lock_days]. Once a Backup is created, this value may only be increased. Defaults to the parent BackupPlan's [backup_retain_days][google.cloud.gkebackup.v1.BackupPlan.RetentionPolicy.backup_retain_days] value.

methods.name: getEtag
methods.description:
Output only. etag is used for optimistic concurrency control as a way to help prevent simultaneous updates of a backup from overwriting each other.

It is strongly suggested that systems make use of the etag in the read-modify-write cycle to perform backup updates in order to avoid race conditions: An etag is returned in the response to GetBackup, and systems are expected to put that etag in the request to UpdateBackup or DeleteBackup to ensure that their change will be applied to the same version of the resource.

Generated from protobuf field string etag = 24 [(.google.api.field_behavior) = OUTPUT_ONLY];
